newsitem.title: USA: Browning-Ferris says to sell some locations.
newsitem.headline: Browning-Ferris says to sell some locations.

text.p: Browning-Ferris Industries Inc said Thursday it plans to sell operating locations with annual revenues of about $400 million.
The company said it has sent out information on those locations to prospective buyers. It said its goal is to close most of those locations during the calendar year.
Browning-Ferris, a waste services company, did not say how many locations it planned to close.

The company announced its plans as it released its first quarter results, showing net income of $71.88 million, or $0.36 per share, on revenues of $1.5 billion. In the prior year's first quarter, the company reported net income of $83.01 million, or $0.42 per share, on revenues of $1.4 billion.

"Our first quarter results demonstrate progress in our pursuit of improving BFI's performance," President and Chief Executive Bruce Ranck said in a statement. "Lowering costs, enhancing revenue and reducing assets will continue to be key areas of focus during the balance of this fiscal year."
